text: {| |} Indian Chief was an American vessel that appeared in Lloyd's Register (LR) in 1797 but was destroyed in a fire in that year. {| class=" wikitable" |- ! Year ! Master ! Owner ! Trade ! Source |- | 1797 | J.Shaw | J.Shaw | London–Lisbon | LRLR (1797), Seq.№178. |- |} On 18 January 1797 Indian Chief, Shaw, master, was at Falmouth when she caught fire. She had a cargo of 1200 casks of pilchards that she was to take to the Straits of Gibraltar. She and her cargo were totally destroyed but due to the assistance of the officers and men of , all aboard were saved."The American ship Indian Chief, Capt. SHAW, with about 1400 casks of pilchards, for the Streights, caught fire." Times [London, England 25 January 1797: 3. The Times Digital Archive. Web. 11 May 2020.] Indian Chief had come from Cornwall. ==Citations== Category:1796 ships Category:Ships built in the United States Category:Age of Sail merchant ships of the United States Category:Maritime incidents in 1797 Category:Ship fires Category:Shipwrecks of England
title: Indian Chief (1796 ship)
